subject: biology
title: Structure of DNA and RNA MCQ Problems

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: What is both DNA and RNA made of?
problems.hint: Alkalides are basic compounds, they have nothing to do with DNA and RNA structure.
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option C. Nucleotides are the building blocks of DNA and RNA.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following correctly lists the components of nucleotides?
options: Phosphate group, nitrogenous base, and ribose
Phosphate group, nitrogenous acid, and ribose
Deoxyribose, nitrogenous base, and phosphate group
problems.hint: There is no such thing as a nitrogenous acid.
problems.detailed: The correct option is B, which was taken from the lesson.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which option correctly describes the difference between purines and pyrimidines?
options: Purines contain one ring while pyrimidines contain two fused rings
Purines contain two rings while pyrimidines contain one ring
problems.hint: Purines are indeed larger than pyrimidines.
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option B. Purines contain two rings while pyrimidine contains one ring.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following nucleotides does uracil replace in RNA?
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option C. Uracil replaces thymine in RNA.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Select the CORRECT option:
options: Figure 1 is a DNA molecule; Figure 2 is an RNA molecule
Figure 1 is an RNA molecule; Figure 2 is a DNA molecule
Figure 1 is a purine; figure 2 is a pyrimidine
Figure 1 is a pyrimidine; figure 2 is a purine
problems.hint: Deoxyriboses have ONE LESS oxygen molecule than riboses.
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option A. Figure one has ONE LESS oxygen molecule than figure, which means figure 1 is a DNA molecule and figure 2 is an RNA molecule.
